newsitem.title: UK: UK prompt natural gas weakens, other periods flat.
newsitem.headline: UK prompt natural gas weakens, other periods flat.

text.p: UK spot natural gas prices were weaker in the prompt period on Thursday but further out along curve, traders and brokers reported little movement.
"It has been very quiet," one dealer said.

At least 350,000 therms per day of within-day gas was traded on a reasonable endeavour basis at 11.05 and 11.1 pence per therm, while weekend gas changed hands for 10.8 pence. Dealers attributed weakness in the short term to a slightly softer System Average Price (SAP.)

Transco said in a note to shippers it would issue a tender on Friday to sell storage gas in a phased disposal over the summer. The quantities were not specified in the note but Transco said last month the tender would be for some 2.4 terawatt-hours.
The tender had no immediate impact on prices on Thursday, traders said.
"I assume the tender has been discounted from the market but the volumes are quite uncertain," one said.
